section.title: receipts correction of Correct P/O Receipt
section.para: To make corrections to a Purchase Order Receipt, select the "Correct Receiving" option from the right-click menu. The following screen will appear:
When correcting a Purchase Order Receipt, you are presented with the following options:

listitem.para: Displays the selected Purchase Order Number.
Displays the selected Line Item Number from the specified Purchase Order.
Displays Item Number associated with the specified Line Item Number.
Displays the Item Number the Vendor uses.
Displays the description for the Vendor Item Number.
Displays the Unit of Measure the Vendor uses for the specified Item.
/Vendor UOM Ratio: Displays the ratio between Inventory and Vendor Units of Measure.

note.para: The Inv./Vendor UOM Ratio specifies the ratio between Inventory and Vendor Units of Measure (UOM). For example, if you store an Item in single units, but a Vendor sells you the Item in cases of 12, then the ratio would be 12â€”or 12:1. When an Inv./Vend. ratio is specified, the system allows you to purchase Items using the Vendor's UOM; however, when the Items are received, the system will automatically convert the Inventory to your Inventory UOM.

listitem.para: Displays the date when the Line Item is due.
Displays the original Line Item quantity ordered.
Displays the total Line Item quantity received to date.
Enter the quantity you want to correct the received quantity to. This correction will create adjusting General Ledger entries when the CORRECT button is selected.

varlistentry.term: freight correcting for purchasing Correct Freight to

listitem.para: Enter the amount you want to correct the Line Item freight to. This correction will create adjusting General Ledger entries when the CORRECT button is selected.
This is a scrolling text field with word-wrapping for entering Notes related to the correction.

section.para: To the far right of the screen, the following buttons are available:

listitem.para: Closes the screen without entering a correction, returning you to the application desktop.
Select to post the correction. This action will result in adjusting General Ledger transactions.
